front.title: QUIC-enabled Service Differentiation for Traffic Engineering

abstract.t: This document defines a method for supporting QUIC-enabled service differentiation for traffic engineering through multipath and QUIC connection identifier (CID) encoding. This approach enables end-host networking stacks and applications to select packet routing paths in a wide area network (WAN), potentially improving end-to-end performance, cost, and reliability. The proposed method can be used in conjunction with segment-routing traffic engineering technologies, such as SRv6 TE.
